description: Game setup complete with 10 players
Blood on the Clocktower game started with 10 players
Setup phase complete, transitioning to Night phase
Storyteller → Emma, James, Daniel, Emily, Susan, Jack, John, Olivia, Michael, Steve: Night has begun on round 1.
Storyteller → Emily: Three good roles not in play are Mayor, Chef, Butler and your minion(s) are Susan, John
Storyteller → Susan, John: The Demon is Emily.

Storyteller → John: You have poisoned Michael for the night and next day. Your reasoning: As the Poisoner, I know Emily is the Demon. I want to disrupt potential good team information gathering by poisoning Michael, who might be a Townsfolk with an investigative ability like Investigator or Fortune Teller. Preventing him from getting accurate information will help our Evil team's chances of winning.

description:
Storyteller → Susan: THE GRIMOIRE:
=== PLAYER CHARACTERS ===
Emma: Virgin (ALIVE)
James: Undertaker (ALIVE)
Daniel: Investigator (ALIVE)
Emily: Imp (ALIVE)
Susan: Spy (ALIVE)
Jack: Drunk (ALIVE)
John: Poisoner (ALIVE)
Olivia: Slayer (ALIVE)
Michael: Fortuneteller (ALIVE)
Steve: Librarian (ALIVE)

=== DRUNK & POISONED ===
Michael is poisoned by: John

=== ACTIVE REMINDER TOKENS ===
Drunk - Is_the_Drunk: Jack
Fortuneteller - Fortuneteller_Red_Herring: Daniel
Investigator - Investigator_Minion: John
Investigator - Investigator_Other: Jack
Librarian - Librarian_Outsider: Jack
Librarian - Librarian_Other: Steve

=== SPECIAL INFO ===
Jack (Drunk) thinks they are: Washerwoman
Storyteller → Jack: One of these players is the Soldier: Steve, Emily
Storyteller → Steve: One of these players is the Drunk: Jack, Steve
Storyteller → Daniel: One of these players is the Poisoner: John, Jack

Storyteller → Michael: Yes, one of Emma and James is the Demon. Your reasoning: As a Fortune Teller, I need to choose two players to check if either is the Demon. Emma and James are seated next to each other, which might provide interesting information about potential evil adjacency. They are also early in the player order, which could give me strategic insight.

metadata.private_reasoning: As a Fortune Teller, I need to choose two players to check if either is the Demon. Emma and James are seated next to each other, which might provide interesting information about potential evil adjacency. They are also early in the player order, which could give me strategic insight.

description: Emma updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• First Night Event: Night has begun on round 1
• Game Setup: 10 players total, standard configuration of 6 Townsfolk, 1 Outsider, 2 Minions, 1 Demon
• As Virgin, my special ability is: If a Townsfolk nominates me first, the nominator dies immediately

Strategy:
• Carefully monitor nominations to protect myself and potentially expose an evil player through their nomination
• Engage in collaborative discussions to gather information about potential Evil team members
• Be strategic about when and how to use my unique nomination protection ability, as it can be a powerful deterrent

description: James updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• History Summary:
   - Round 1 has started
   - Night phase is currently active
   - 10 players are alive
   - All players have their initial game state intact

• Strategy:
   - As Undertaker, gather critical information about executed characters each night to help identify Evil players
   - Collaborate with other Good players to share information and track potential Evil team members
   - Be cautious about revealing my role too early, as Evil players might target me to block my information gathering ability

description: Daniel updated their notes

metadata.notes:
History Summary:
• Night 1: Storyteller informed me that one of John or Jack is the Poisoner
• Current game state is first night phase with all 10 players alive

Strategic Action Points:
• Seek to validate the Storyteller's information about John/Jack potentially being the Poisoner through careful observation and conversation
• Track how other players interact with John and Jack to gather additional context about the potential Poisoner
• Prioritize gathering information from other players about their character roles to help identify the Evil team members

description: Emily updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Game started on Round 1, Night phase
• Storyteller informed me I'm the Imp
• Storyteller revealed three good roles NOT in play: Mayor, Chef, Butler
• My minions are Susan and John

Strategy:
• Carefully observe voting patterns and social dynamics to identify potential good team players to kill
• Coordinate secretly with Susan and John to spread disinformation and protect the Demon (me)
• Plan kills that will create confusion and disrupt the good team's ability to identify the Demon

description: Susan updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Initial Round Summary:
  - Night phase, learned Emily is the Demon
  - Accessed Grimoire during night
  - John is Poisoner and has poisoned Michael (Fortuneteller)
  - Jack is Drunk and thinks he's a Washerwoman
  - Daniel is Investigator with a token about John (Minion)
  - Steve is Librarian with a token about Jack (Outsider)

• Strategic Priorities:
  - Carefully use Grimoire information to subtly guide town suspicion away from Evil team
  - Work with John (Poisoner) to manipulate information and create confusion
  - Blend in as a potential Good player to avoid early suspicion, potentially appearing as a Townsfolk

description: Jack updated their notes

metadata.notes:
## Game Summary
- Night 1: Received information that one of Steve or Emily is the Soldier
- 10 players total in the game
- 6 Townsfolk, 1 Outsider, 2 Minions, 1 Demon initially

## Strategic Priorities
- As Washerwoman, prioritize identifying the other Townsfolk to build trust and coordinate defense against the Demon
- Watch Steve and Emily closely, as one of them might be the protective Soldier
- Share my initial information carefully to avoid being targeted by Evil players, but use it to help eliminate potential Evil team members

metadata.notes:

description: Michael updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• First night as Fortune Teller: Received information that either Emma or James is the Demon
• Initial check targets were Emma and James due to their adjacency and position in player order
• Storyteller's statement implies some strategic uncertainty in the initial check

• Strategy: Carefully observe Emma and James's behavior and interactions during the day phase to validate or challenge the night's information
• Strategy: Share information with other Good team players cautiously, focusing on building trust and identifying potential Evil players
• Strategy: Be prepared to use Fortune Teller ability again in subsequent nights to gain more information about potential Demon location

description: Steve updated their notes

metadata.notes:
• Game Started: Round 1, Night Phase
• Storyteller Information: Told that Jack or Steve is the Drunk
• Potential Strategy Implications: 
   - Since I'm a Librarian, my information about Outsiders could be unreliable if I am the Drunk
   - Need to be cautious about trusting my own initial information
• Key Questions to Investigate:
   - Confirm whether I am actually drunk
   - Determine which (if any) of the two players is actually the Drunk

• Strategy Bullet Points:
   1. Communicate my Librarian information transparently to build trust with good team
   2. Watch for inconsistencies that might reveal the Drunk or Evil players
   3. Prioritize gathering information and collaborating with other good players to identify the Demon
